review.reviewBody: Shorts are lightweight, very comfortable, have plenty of pockets, and are dressy enough to wear around town after biking. My first pair of Norrie bike shorts and am very pleased.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the deep side pockets on these shorts. That's what makes them my go-to pair. I wear them biking, hiking and everything in between.  The material is light weight, but sturdy. They run big. I'm 5'6" and the small comes to the middle of my knee. I also cinch the waist as far as possible. With that though, the fit is good for me.
review.name: Love these shorts

review.reviewBody: I have always loved the Norrie 2.0 Short, and have several pairs. They are my go-to shorts for mountain biking and for everyday wear. It was easy to see why they were Yeti's #1 selling women's short. Then they changed the design and material. The short is longer by a good inch and the material seems lighter -- or perhaps it's cut differently. Seems like there's a lot of material. I always order an "M" so I don't feel restricted with a bike liner, but these felt too big in all the wrong places. Sadly, I'm done with Yeti for the time-being.
review.name: Wanted to Like

review.reviewBody:
Waist band is super big. Even tightening the side cinches wasn't enough.  Tried a size down and the waist was ok, but thighs were then super tight.
Nice product though if it fitted.
review.name: Weird Fit

name: Norrie 2.0 Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love them!  My only request is that Chaco make the pull strap tail a little shorter.  It drags on the ground on all of my Chacos… until I shorten them.
review.name: Love the Rapid Pros!

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely love these sandals and have been wearing them non-stop all summer long - daily walks, backcountry paddle boarding, sea kayaking, on the beach to the grocery store. You get it! 
They took a bit to get used to in terms of where the straps sat and rubbed on the feet but my feet feel supported, can't feel rocks and are very grippy even in the water.
Unfortunately on my recent sea kayaking trip the Vibram sole has started to come off. Simple glue fix but wasn't expecting this to happen.
review.name: Awesome sandal but soles come off
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: Usually I wear the z cloud because I need the extra cushion.  I have not been able  to find the cloud without the toe strap in a color I like.   I called to complain and the person I spoke to suggested I try the Rapid Pro. I just knew I was not going to like it.  WELL I was wrong.    Great shoe and very comfortable.   No foot problems.  Thank you for helping me take care of my feet!
review.name: Great shoe!!!
comment: Thanks for the great review!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and steady on slippery wet rocks.  I love these.
review.name: Hold firm in wet conditions
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback!

review.reviewBody: Love my new Chacos! Really like the new colors and they fit perfectly.
review.name: Love the new Rapid Pro
comment: Thanks for the love Michael!

review.reviewBody: Yesterday took them on slippery Alaskan rocks. Worked like glue. Wish I bought the wider strap ones though.
review.name: Get the extra grip. Its worth it.

review.reviewBody: No cushion, like walking on a piece of wood. I had to stop at a store and buy Tevas to make it through the day.
review.name: Very uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. I have wore these almost everyday since I got them. At concerts, swimming in rivers, and on hikes. They are versatile.
review.name: Perfect summer outdoor shoe
comment: Thanks Jen!

review.reviewBody:
Really great overall! But so narrow on my feet. I sized up but almost wish I'd gone one more even though length is spot on. I'd buy mens, but they don't run small enough, and no rapid pro kids option either. 
Hiked with a friend wearing regular chacos on a rainy hike up and around some small cliffs. Any time he slid or fell from traction, I'd try it in my chacos and couldn't even make them slip an inch on wet rock.
review.name: Great traction, needs a wide size option

review.reviewBody: In love with my new chacos! So happy they came in time for an upcoming camping trip. Really adore the color and overall style. Thank you Chaco for getting more size 6 back in stock!
review.name: Love!
comment: Thanks for the love Nell!

name: Rapid Pro Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've had these for about 2 months and they are terrific.  The engineering is especially impressive.  The length is easily adjusted--and it locks in place with Evers mounted on the poles.  These of a partial glove for the hand holds is unique--you can push on the top  off the pole to remove the and assembly from the pole...and it snaps back on easily.  Rubber pads slip over the tips for walking in smooth areas like concrete paths.  Overall a delight to use
review.name: Excellent engineering design

review.reviewBody: I found the leki poles to be extremely easy to use and lightweight. They saved me from face planting going down a rocky slope 🙂
review.name: Life saver

review.reviewBody: By using the Leki walking poles, I am getting more of a cardio workout.
review.name: Cardio Walking!

review.reviewBody: warm and light, perfect for traveling. Lots of pockets
review.name: great jacket for everyday use

review.reviewBody: This will be great for brutally cold days and shoveling snow.  Hopefully I won’t need it this winter.  Lol
review.name: I got it but don’t want snow

review.reviewBody: purchased this jacket for my girlfriend, and she's a big fan.
review.name: reliable and built for the long haul

review.reviewBody: Great coat, great fit. I use this for nights up in the snow when I am outside.
review.name: Great fit, great coat.

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so cute, I’m in love. I took it on a trip with me to Colorado and it kept me cozy, warm, and most importantly, it looked fire. The material is almost like a rip stop kinda thing, which was different than I had expected. But it’s quite warm for as light as it is. This is probably my all time favorite parka - and that’s saying a lot bc I’m truly a jacket fanatic. If you’re on the fence about this one, this is your sign to go for it! You will not regret it :)
review.name: Your ticket to cozy town

review.reviewBody: Love! I love this winter coat! Warm, light, flexible, breathable.  Sometimes I forget I have it on and wear it in the house!! Love love.
review.name: Best winter coat I’ve owned (from a Minnesotan!)

review.reviewBody: Best purchase in a long time. So comfy and warm. Love the all the pockets! Great color too. Fits true to size, relaxed fit. I'm normally an XS or S and went with the small for ultra layering capability and a bigger fit.
review.name: New favorite winter coat!

review.reviewBody: I searched for awhile for a fitted coat that was also super warm.  I get so cold during the winter!!  I’ve had this coat a month and I love it.  It’s very warm getting into our colder Northern Michigan winter and I love the color.   I get a lot of compliments and even had a woman tell me she went out and bought the same coat after she saw mine.  After reading the reviews, I’m 5’7 and 140lbs.  I bought a small and it fits perfectly
review.name: Super warm and cute coat

review.reviewBody: I love this coat.  It's form fitted, repels water, and it warm!
review.name: Best winter coat!

review.reviewBody: Wore this every single day in December. The Dark Marsh color is beautiful, it's super warm and has great lined pockets so my hands don't get cold. The hood is amazing too and when it's fully zipped up it's great at keeping the wind and snow out of your face. Super convenient to just throw this on and be warm enough for anything.
review.name: New favorite jacket

name: Nevadan Down Parka - Women's

description: Buy the MSR LowDown Remote Stove Adapter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: LowDown Remote Stove Adapter
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR LowDown Remote Stove Adapter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: much safer to use than pocket rocket attached directly to cannister top. good regulation of flame from adapter valve.
review.name: safer cooking

review.reviewBody: I'm not so sure. As my canister was almost empty and I used the adapter but couldn't get enough gas to come out to light a fire.
review.name: Does it work? Make it last longer?

review.reviewBody:
Works just like you think it would.
I was always a bit nervous around the higher more unstable base of the stove without adaptor, especially if you are boiling up a liter or more.
The low-down is still sorta tall but has a much more stable base for all the boiling you need to do
review.name: Works just like you think

review.reviewBody: Provides added stability to my stoves by lowering the height and widening the base
review.name: Added stability to my stoves

review.reviewBody: Have used the LowDown on two occasions already and this is an excellent platform for stability. I use a 14 cup GSI percolator and that's quite a large coffee pot on a stove like the MSR Pocket Rocket Deluxe. Not one issue in connecting everything and perfect stability. Good camping!
review.name: Excellent product...

review.reviewBody: Loves the stability it gives when using larger pots/pans.
review.name: Loves the stability it gives

review.reviewBody: I used this on my last trek and it worked great. If you're a gram counter, not going to be for you. But as a guide doing group treks, this will work perfect for the larger pots, keeping them low.
review.name: Stability

review.reviewBody:
provide a lower ,more stable base, perfect for larger pots, I love it

Stef
review.name: provide a lower ,more stable

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic bit of kit and i love mine but it could be better. The way it works does not need any changing just the materials its made from. I think i would have payed a bit more for a lighter all titanium version or maybe titanium legs slimmed down a bit for lightweight backpacking. Overall the product is great tho and i would recommend
review.name: Great but could be greater

review.reviewBody: Works much better with windsurfer and pocket rocket
review.name: Works much better with windsurfer

name: LowDown Remote Stove Adapter

description: Buy the Helly Hansen Canyon Duffel Pack 50L online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Canyon Duffel Pack 50L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Helly Hansen Canyon Duffel Pack 50L online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a larger backpack I could take on camping and bus/train trips. It fits so much and the ability to modify how you hold it is handy. It took a while to get used to the opening coming from the bottom of the bag, but it’s nice to be able to access everything in the bag at once instead of having to take many things out and put them back in for one item. The backpack straps are sturdy, and it’s nice to be able to put them away.
review.name: Great Backpack

review.reviewBody: The Canyon 50L makes for an excellent gear bag! The multiple grab handles and tough material on the bottom makes it great for sliding around the bed of your truck or at the base of your crag. Though the handles are tough enough to carry it with just one, you aren't able to use two handles at a time for a side carry like most travel duffels. Otherwise, the shoulder straps are easy to attach for a comfortable carry, and it's nice to have a dedicated pocket so they aren't getting misplaced when not in use!
review.name: Great Gear Bag!

review.reviewBody: Just picked up this duffel for a camping trip up in Idaho and it's great for a weekend getaway. Able to pack my clothes and toiletries easily, with lots of room for extras as well. The face material is strong enough that I don't have to worry about small scratches from branches and it has the classic quality HH is known for. It's a great 50L pack right at $100!
review.name: Another great HH pack!

name: Canyon Duffel Pack 50L

review.reviewBody: Wonderful product and VERY quiet. I’ve had many roof racks over the years and none of them were as quiet as this one at speed. Very satisfied.
review.name: Well engineered

review.reviewBody: I ordered the wing bar edge for my Mazda CX-5 according to the Thule website. Based on the make, model, and year of my car, the website said it was a guaranteed fit. The 95 cm was too big. The 86 cm fits in the front but not the back. I was able to return the 95 for the 77 cm; however, this bar is too short. Therefore, I can’t recommend this product.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Purchased a few weeks ago to take my bike (top ride) about 500 miles away. Easy to install, fit perfectly and I was amazed at how quite it was traveling 70+ MPH to my destination.
review.name: Fit perfectly and extremely quiet

review.reviewBody: Bought the Edge flush rail base roof rack a few weeks back for a 23' BMW X3. It looks amazing on the vehicle and is exceptionally quiet.
review.name: Great look, function, and Quiet!

review.reviewBody: We immediately bought these after the purchase of our new Volvo XC60.  The factory suggested ones were more expensive and in my opinion didn’t look as good on the vehicle.  These are all blacked out and match the cars styling.  Super simple to install and feels very sturdy.
review.name: Great Look-Fits Perfect

review.reviewBody: The product is well built and designed, however it creates excessive noise when driving.  I have 2 other Thule roof systems on my other cars and they do not generate such noise when driving.
review.name: Excessive noise

review.reviewBody: Works great on my 2024 Palisade.  The front bar is a bit short so I had to set it up a couple inches further back than the instructions.  With my Box on the crossbars, I can't open the sunroof fully, but I don't use this when I have a cargo box on top. Overall very happy!
review.name: Clean lines

review.reviewBody: This product was a perfect fit for my 2022 HR-V Honda. Fit like a glove! Not like a OJ glove 🤪! Very well thought out product so far it is doing its job
review.name: Excellent Product

review.reviewBody: This appears to be a sturdy and well constructed product.  I would strongly advise watching the tutorial and stopping as many times as needed during the installation.  Also, get the lock package that is sold separately.  After doing that, the installation went well and the product seems well secured. to my vehicle.
review.name: Sturdy Product

review.reviewBody: Paid a lot of extra money for 2 day air shipping. Part of package came in 3 days , which was too late for us to use. We ended up going on a long holiday road trip without the Roof Box we needed and spent a lot of money on.
review.name: Arrived too late for trip
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the order experience. I understand your frustration with the order not arriving in time for your trip. 
Orders typically are shipped the following business day, depending on when in the day an order was placed. Thule takes every precaution to make sure orders arrive on time as expected. Unfortunately, once an order leaves our warehouse, we are unable to control how quickly it arrives. 
Please contact Thule customer support about the issue to see what options are available for resolution.

review.reviewBody: Highly breathable jacket with a great athletic fit. Breathes better than any GTX jacket I've ever had. I bought a second one to keep in my work vehicle I was so impressed by the first one.
review.name: Highly breathable. Athletic fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Marmot has a long history of making high quality outerwear. And this history continues with Mitre peak Jacket. I have been a fan of Marmot since my first jacket (the Alpine Light Jacket) which has been with me for most of my outdoor adventures into the backcountry and high altitude peak. I still remember when the 10,000 meter parka was the one of the best pieces of equipment a mountaineer could have for protection at very cold, high altitudes. Not sure if they still make that. Back to the review of this jacket. I like the fact that it is does not come with a liner so this makes it more versatile for layer. Not sure of the durability for and longevity as the material is lighter and therefor repeated use with pack straps and harnesses may wear stress areas out as they are not reinforced. I have yet to find rainy enough day where the jacket has not performed. Hopefully this waterproofing with continue over the life time of the jacket. My biggest issue now with the latest products from all makers (Patagonia, The North Face, etc) is the delamination of the gortex material after a few years of use. Hopefully they have resolved this issue. Looking forward to many years of use with this jacket. Check in with me in a few years, I will let you know how this performed
review.name: Great light weight Jacket

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Haven't tried this out in the rain and will be returning because of the fit. The waist is just too tight, for reference I'm 5'11" 180 lbs with a 34 waist. The medium fits great in the sleeves, shoulders and chest but it is tight around the hips. Yes there is a 2nd zipper to zip up at the bottom to loosen it up but there I'm worried about putting too much pressure on the zipper when being active and damaging it. 
Other than the hips, it fit great, the hood is large to fit over a helmet but the adjustment works very well when not wearing one. The neck zips up nice and high to protect chin from the wind and all zippers are smooth and waterproof. Material felt high quality. Bummed to return it.
review.name: Nice jacket, tight fit.
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for leaving the review on our product. We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion.

We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us via the website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us.

Thank you!
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great but personally do not like the color which is not suitable to me
review.name: Great but personally do not like the color

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] High Quality Jacket. Light weight. I'm 5-11, 235lbs. 48 chest and XXL fits perfect. Enough room for a thick layer underneath. The only bad is the Gore-Tex material feels a little crunchy but nothing serious. Will definitely  wear on my next summit. Paid half of the original price too! Totally Rocks!
review.name: Rock On !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] One of the best all-around rain jackets I have owned. Solid materials/construction that keeps me dry
review.name: One of the best

review.reviewBody: Great jacket. Seems durable and waterproof. Good purchase!
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best lightweight jacket I ever owned. I wear it whether hiking or watching lacrosse games of my grandson when it looks like rain.. Terrific features like pit, zips, separate packets, spacious hood, and adjustable Velcro cuffs.
review.name: Looking for a lightweight jacket, no further!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had this jacket for less than a year, and I have only used it in light rainy conditions (mostly walking around town). It is taken in and out of my backpack quite a bit. It sheds water well and keeps me dry when I have it on which would bode well for more extreme conditions.

My major concern is that despite not using it much, there is already a small hole on the inside of the jacket in one of the pockets, and it looks like there might be a couple more spots where holes will appear soon. Not sure if I got a dud given other positive reviews, though. I don't think I've snagged the jacket anywhere, and if I did, it would have been significantly less severe than anything it would likely experience outdoors.
review.name: Durability?
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.
 
We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
My Goretex Mitre Peak Jacket arrived just in time to withstand some really harsh rain, hail, and the biggest snowstorm to hit the Ausangate region of Peru in more than 25years. Needless to say I was quite comfortable with this Jacket and really enjoyed watching the heavy precipitation literally shedding off this Goretex jacket like “water off a ducks back.”
Packs down small and doesn’t weigh much which was an added bonus for the backpacking trip around the mountains here. A must have for any serious outdoor enthusiasts who want to stay dry on their next outing.
review.name: Super dry super lightweight

name: Mitre Peak GORE-TEX Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Gravel Grinder TLR Tubeless Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Challenge Gravel Grinder TLR Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I used the 700x42 as a rear on my Pinarello gravel bike and rode the White Rim trail and had no issues with the tire. It rolled fast, gripped well, and has not suffered any damage despite being subject to many rocky, ledgy drops and some rockier mountain bike trails.

It was pretty easy to mount on a FSA Vision Trimax 30 rim with a compressor to seat the bead.

I don't know what this other person was talking about as far as sandy jeep roads go the White Rim consists largely of sandy jeep roads and this tire worked great in areas other than super deep sand and climbs too steep and sandy to ride anyway. I did not notice any issues with grip on the climbs.

The center tread is pretty "slick" but I wouldn't say they slip on climbs anymore than any other knobby mountain bike tire would slip on a steeper climb.
review.name: worked great on White Rim

name: Gravel Grinder TLR Tubeless Tire

review.reviewBody:
Great fitting helmet! For many years, I was buying the Smith Maze helmet in a size large. I would upgrade every few years because of dents but  It was cheap and did the job. Now that I've turned 40 and going on my 37th season skiing (most of which we didn't wear helmets) I thought I would treat myself to something a little better quality, feel  and fit. 

I did have to size down on Nexus helmet as it seems to run a bit larger that the Maze.  I could have gotten away with a large, specially with the BOA feature, however the Medium fits perfect!
review.name: Love the fit and style of this helmet!

review.reviewBody:
last day of the season, someone basically pushed me off the ski lift, and I fell sideways, slamming down pretty hard, AND THEN they landed on top of me. (they werent small) 

ANyway, that was the sort of fall that would have really rung my bell, normally  - but I was fine, and was able to get myself home, so I'm looking to order another one for this season. :p
review.name: Certainly did its job!

review.reviewBody: I tried this on and it feels and fits true to size.  It feels very protective.  For me it feels way too warm as I am always too hot on the mountain.  The ear flaps are not removable which is a deal breaker for me.  Still highly recommended.
review.name: Looks and feels really warm and protecti

review.reviewBody: The best ski helmet anywhere with plenty of room, protection and a comfortable fit. Highly recommended!
review.name: The best helmet ever

review.reviewBody: This helmet has great features and wanted to love the fit but just doesn’t work for me. I was able to try on a medium before ordering that was just a hair too small. The only large I was able to try was the Vantage which fit great. The Nexus large fits much looser than the Vantage large and cinched to a proper fit put the visitor so low on the forehead none of the goggles I tried would fit well. Just could not get it adjusted for a comfortable fit and had to return it and getting the Vantage. Quality, style, and features of the Nexus are top notch and if it fit me as well as the Vantage does would be five stars all the way.
review.name: Sizing runs larger than Vantage

review.reviewBody: Fits perfect with my smith goggles, very comfortable also
review.name: Sweet helmet

review.reviewBody: Not the warmest helmet. Adding a hood/liner helps, and not otherwise being warm means it works better as it gets warmer. Great integration with my Smith goggles, which never fog. Had an issue with a previous Smith helmet with the goggle retainer getting too stretched. It looks like the goggle retainer on the Nexus is not replaceable (which I find odd, as that is a high warranty issue. Had to remove foam from the earpiece to get music speakers to fit. Even doing that, the fit was pretty snug (same size as old helmet). But after a couple weeks, I have either adapted or it has packed out a little. I like the magnetic buckle. Light, but not the lightest helmet out there. Expensive, but my head is worth it.
review.name: Nice Helmet

review.reviewBody: The helmet alone is an excellent product in terms of comfort, weight and fit. The problem is its very poor quality carrying bag compared to the old ones. One of the seams gave way and as a result the helmet fell on the concrete slab of my garage, damaging it. Frustrating for a new helmet of this price.
review.name: Carrying bag

review.reviewBody: I love this helmet! The multi directional protection makes me feel safer when riding through tree lines. Easy to put on and adjust, and my googles fit perfectly and snug.
review.name: Best Everyday Helmet

review.reviewBody: I’m enjoying my Nexus so far. This helmet fits me better than other Smith helmets I’ve used. The buckle, sleek design and high confidence in safety make this a great buy.
review.name: Right fit for me

name: Nexus Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I’ve bought 2 pairs in this style. I love the shoes!! But was very disappointed that both pairs of shoes started to come apart on the sides of the toe part where shoe creases.
review.name: Great shoe, tears easily on the sides

review.reviewBody: More street style than most snow boots. Great customer service!!! Above and beyond phone helpers
review.name: Nice boots. Backcountry is the best!

review.reviewBody: I’ve used these for the last month or so. They are perfect for snow skating and getting around the base area of the resort. Classic vans style.
review.name: Perfect Snowskate Footwear

review.reviewBody:
Bought these for a trip to Banff and they did not disappoint. Warm in negative temps, great grip, and comfortable walking through a lot of ice and fresh powder. Felt fine while jogging along a dog sled too.

As stated by other reviews, order up a size. I'm a 10.5-11 and ordered a 12. They fit great.
review.name: Solid Option for Casual Snow Boots

review.reviewBody: Perfect for the trip to the slopes or getting around on snowy days. Easy transition to ski boots. And stylish while doing it... love me some vans
review.name: Comfortable, warm, stylish

review.reviewBody: I dont typically run into the problem where I have to order a size or half size larger in a shoe.  I don't think I have a single size 9 shoe in my closet.  I have multiple pairs of vans classic slip ons and they are all 8/8.5 and fit fine.  My toes were jammed right up to the end in these as well as crushed in on the sides.  Not sure if I want to bother trying to order another side unless I try them on elsewhere.  Then I would purchase them through Backcountry because they have such a great return policy that makes these problems a little less painful.
review.name: Runs a size too small/maybe too narrow

review.reviewBody:
I live in New Hampshire, and this is my everyday shoe for half the year. Waterproof, light, comfy, great traction, not sweaty, and kind of cool looking- feels like a sneaker, works like a boot. I have half size up from my normal, and they fit perfect. 

After 2 years, the lining in the heel area has split on one shoe, making them difficult to get on- as well as the rubber starting to crack up front. Seems totally fair given how much I wear them. Hoping for a new pair for xmas!
review.name: go to winter everyday

review.reviewBody: As a lady, I found the sizing to be true to size. This has been a nice boot to wear around town in snow and icy conditions. I have worn these with Yak-Trak’s and it’s been a life-saving combo!
review.name: Stylish Snow Boot

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this boot but when I tried it on it fit terribly.  I'm typically a standard 9.5 and I ordered size 10 and it was too tight by a lot.  In addition the boot materials and construction seem very cheap.
review.name: Too small, bad fit, poor quality.

review.reviewBody: These are great, but they run small. I wear a 10 mens in most footwear, and exchanged up for a 10.5 which fit perfect. With laces loosened up and pre-tied I can slip these on and off hands free. They are warm for a light boot, comfortable, and just tall enough to keep snow out when you step into a plow berm after some creative parking. My only complaint is the stiffness of the upper cuff, which digs into my calves but will presumably soften with some break in.
review.name: Casual winter shoe

name: Standard Mid Snow MTE Boot

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, only missing that inner pocket on the upper inside.  Wearing hearing aids, I need to keep my phone close....not had that pocket was a deal breaker for me... I also carry my weight up front--I would have felt better in a 2xl....the downside of "the girls"
review.name: Super warm and light weight.

review.reviewBody: I bought this parka for my sister. Color is this beautiful deep plum, with a bit of sheen on the surface. At first I did not notice it was 800 down, but it is, so that's why the parka  is a bit more puffy than synthetic fill. Well made, nice fit.
review.name: Good quality, graceful fit, very light

review.reviewBody: This very expensive jacket had 6 stains on the front. It had obviously been worn before and been returned used. Buyer beware when ordering from this company.
review.name: Received an obviously pre-worn item.

review.reviewBody: Took this parka to Everest Base Camp alongside other layers since I was going to be going from sub-tropical to Arctic in 10-days. It was a light piece to pack and got the job done (for about 30 mins of exposure), when layered with proper wind breakers and underlayers. I would have preferred a different parka under different conditions, but this one did the trick.
review.name: Light, layer-able, got the job done

review.reviewBody: Oh, this down parka is simply wonderful. The perfect length keeps my upper legs warm when outside in the cold weather. Wouldn’t trade it for the world!
review.name: Perfect Ghost Whisper Parka

review.reviewBody: I had this same coat for several years and was looking to replace it. I was pleased to find the same coat but in a longer length. This works very well for me as it helps me stay warm through my core. It’s nice that it falls below my trunk line and does protect my backside against the cold.
review.name: Love the length, it covers my butt

review.reviewBody: Unusually wonderfully light in weight …and…very warm, would have liked it in more colors
review.name: Would like more colors

review.reviewBody: I have the glacial in size XL . I'm 5'6 190lbs . It fits great. The expectations of an ultralight jacket are there. I can literally see through it in a brightly lit room. If I had any complaints it's just that the cut is not very flattering and the sleeve cuffs are too big. The elastic isn't very elastic. There's definitely about an inch or more of open space there... That being said for what it is the jacket is surprisingly warm enough for my needs . I've worn it down to -3c so far and been warm with a light sweater under it.
review.name: It's is what it says it is. Light and warm.

review.reviewBody: So pleased with this parka version of the Ghost Whisperer line!  I have the jacket also and when I saw this parka I jumped at it.  The sizing is different (for me) though.  The jacket version I wear a Medium, but the Medium in this parka was a little too roomy for what I wanted, so I returned for the Small.  I am 5'4, 132 and 36C.  The bust area is a little more close when zipped, so I won't be wearing anything thick under it.  But it's the right size for my needs, wanted an everyday longer coat that's not bulky.  These Ghost Whisperers are the best ever for lightweight (like air) and I find them very hardy (warm, and can take a lot of wear and tear).  I bought the "Glacial" colour and it's exactly like photo.  Hope this helps.  A happy Mountain Hardwear customer.
review.name: Best parka ever!

review.reviewBody: This Jacket keep you warm enough from cold wind like Canadian weather. The weight is super light and absolutely comfortable.  I’m loving it!
review.name: Best Down Jacket

name: Ghost Whisperer Parka - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Ridge Sherpa Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the Rugged Ridge™ II Sherpa Full Zip Shirt a few weeks ago, and it has quickly become one of my favorite cold-weather layers for boy. The Sherpa lining is incredibly soft and keeps my boy warm without being too bulky. I love the full-zip design, which makes it easy to adjust based on the temperature, and the zippered pockets are perfect for securely holding my son phone and small toys. It’s durable and stylish, and I’ve worn it for both outdoor activities and casual outings. Highly recommend it for anyone needing a reliable, comfortable shirt for chilly days!
review.name: Amazing purchase of 2024

review.reviewBody: I'm not sure what Lenz was thinking when they made this sock and called it "slim fit". The fit is exactly the same as the 6.1 Heat sock - the difference is in the cheaper material (more polyester/less wool). Additionally, the cheaper fabric makes the top of the sock (where the heating element strip is) more lumpy and therefore less comfortable. The Lenz heated sock is a great product - spend the extra $ for the better material in the 6.1
review.name: Get the 6.1's!

name: 5.1 Slim Fit Heat Sock

I paid a significant amount (16.99) for "2-day Air Shipping" only to be sure to receive this product in time to make a bike trip. Ordered it on Sunday morning, received it Wednesday at 4:59pm, no kidding. I contacted Backcountry and I was blown-off. That's pretty slimy business.

review.reviewBody: I am an elementary school teacher and am constantly on my feet. These are my wear every day boots. I actually have two pairs that I trade out every day or so. In my experience they run a tiny bit small. I buy a half size larger than my normal size.

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for my wife to replace an old pair. The sizing is about a 1/2 size small which is normal.  There are some differences from the original. The deal breaker is that the tongue of the boot is removable and secured only to the boot by velcro.  It’s padding does not taper toward the toe causing a wired bulge and potential issue.  It is unfortunate as these boots otherwise are great and the other changes are positive like the capped toe.

review.reviewBody: Work's really well. My only reason I gave it a 3 star is that the gears for the compression is noisy.
review.name: I like the heat , massage and overall settings.

review.reviewBody: Works well and I do enjoy using it. My only complaint is it rests too heavily on my eyes and I wish there was more space there. More of a pocket for my eyes. More massage and sound options, including guiding meditation and "sound bowls” or "brain tickling” would be cool. Not sure if those are the right terms or not….
review.name: Enjoyable

review.reviewBody: But not so comfortable to wear
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I am a busy law student who struggles with sleep, anxiety, and migraines. Luckily, I have seen a shift in my mental and physical health since using SmartGoggles everyday. It's worth every penny. Here's to relaxation with the coolest device on the market.
review.name: A must buy for stressed students!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Therabody is one of my favorite innovators in the game, and I especially loved their Smart Goggles. I have a rough time with getting proper sleep and decompressing before bed. This device is perfect for helping with that and also keeping a good track of how it's been helping you. You can connect the device to the Therabody app and control the device from there + your progress in terms of heart rate at the beginning/ end of usage. There are 3 levels to the heat and 3 different types of modes (Relax, Sleep, Focus). The app also comes with audio in case you want that with any of your modes. The device is one of the more expensive ones on the market, but it's well worth it if you are consistent with your use!
review.name: Helpful

review.reviewBody: The first time I used this I thought I hated it but by the end of a 20 minute sleep session I was hooked! The fit can be a little awkward but overall the relaxation benefits are amazing. I use this most nights before bed and highly recommend!
review.name: Not perfect but pretty amazing

review.reviewBody: Have been using this for the last 3 weeks, 30 minutes nightly prior to sleep, have not noticed any improvement in falling asleep or sleeping longer. Will continue to use it, hopefully improvement will come later.
review.name: No improvement yet

review.reviewBody: Impressed
review.name: Impressed

review.reviewBody: Awesome piece of equipment. It is the solution to stress an incredible unit. Gotta buy it.
review.name: Awesome piece of equipment. It

review.reviewBody: Its ok not great
review.name: Its ok not great

name: Smart Goggles

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Owned 7 pairs of the pro 3d. Very comfortable. Main problem is the last 2 pair I’ve owned the sole separated after 1 year
review.name: Sole separated after 1 year
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of Salomons after the first pair would not fit right and had issues with the tounge constantly falling out of place, causing discomfort. I switched to these shoes and found them opposite of the last shoes. These were too tight, leading my toes to bunch up against each other - which led to massive blisters while hiking. These do seem to provide decent support, but finding a pair that will actually fit you may be challenging. They are quite airy, which can be a good thing, but leaves them on the colder side when it's cold outside. They seem to be primarily plastic and the soles haven't held up well after roughly 200 miles walked in them. Compared to my cheaper shoes from another backcountry/outdoor company, these leave a lot to hope for. I am nothing but disappointed in the Salomon brand and don't want to continue wearing these after trying over and over again to like them. While most people I know that love them state it takes a while to like them, I think over 200 miles and still getting blisters is beyond enough time. While I'm sure Salomon's are good for some, they are terrible for me and I'll never consider the brand again. 

That said, this shoe does not have the same issue with the tounge of the shoe sliding around as it has a loop in the middle to hold it in place, resolving the design issue of many of their other shoes.
review.name: Worst shoes I've owned in years
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Pretty displeased. I am an 11.5. On a show measuring device. All other shoes including Salomon are 11.5. These fit so loose. They are rather wide. I have a pretty high volume foot and am technically on the wider end of the spectrum. These feel too wide. Worse however is the fact that they are at least a full size to size and a half larger tan stated. My foot wants to slip out every time I step. Very mad since I threw them on for the day and left the house and now I can’t return them.
review.name: Sizing is way off
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We’re sorry we couldn’t find the right solution for you this time. Your case has been passes to the relevant department and will be taken into consideration for improvements in our process

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wore XA Pro 3D's on all 7800+ miles of the triple crown of hiking (roughly 16 pairs across those 3 trails). They've been my go-to hiking shoe since 2016. Secure, stable, great protection.
review.name: Classic and Bomber

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very protective and performs well on rough, rocky trails.
review.name: Good

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: It’s only been a few weeks since I bought my XA Pro 3D V9, but so far I love them. Very comfortable and they have become my everyday shoes.
review.name: Great purchase

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes have been great for fishing and hiking. The pull laces loosen over time but just need a quick retighten.
review.name: Hiking

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The arch fits and feels much different-higher in the heel and much narrower which isn’t comfortable. Had to send the shoes back.
review.name: Not the same as previous models
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I think this is my 6th pair of this shoe in the last 16 hrs! I prefer them to any tennis shoe. Whether it’s for hiking in drier climates, or as a casual shoe for around town, dont think I’ll ever try anything else. Highly recommend!
review.name: Fav “go to shoe”

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ive lost count of how many pairs of these shoes I've owned over the years. My first pair was bright green, about 15 years ago. While I’m not a trail runner, I do a lot of hiking in the Pyrenees, and I can’t recommend these shoes highly enough. Five years ago, I slipped two discs in my back, and these are the only shoes I’ve found that don’t aggravate my back pain on long walks. I’ve tried other great brands—Salewa, Keen, La Sportiva, Scarpa—but the XA Pro always comes out on top.
review.name: Go to shoe...

name: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: The clogs did not fit right on my left foot. I’m 6-1/2 and got size 6. I should have gotten size 7.
review.name: Yogui clogs

review.reviewBody: I usually wear size 8, so ordered an 8. It was too short and the arch support started too close to heel.
review.name: Runs short and arch too far back

review.reviewBody: I just received my 4th pair of these slip on’s and they’re the most comfortable shoes ever. No break in time for me, I wear them right out of the box. Best shoes!!
review.name: Best slip on’s EVER!!!

review.reviewBody: I’m going to lovingly call them “Uglies” ;). They’re very comfortable and they kinda grow on you. I usually wear a 7.5-8 but I sized down to 7. The footbed fit well and provides support that feels very sturdy and stable. The toe box is roomy, but the top strap over the instep is narrow. Granted, I have a slightly above average height instep. It’s so disappointing! If only there was a 7.5!
review.name: Sturdy comfort for average feet

review.reviewBody: Size 8 was too big for my size 8 feet. I gave them to my daughter.
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes were way too big for me - in length and in width. I wear 10.5, which was not available in this style, so I ordered an 11. Besides being too long, it was way too wide, and there was not any way to adjust the width. I'm returning them. Disappointed.
review.name: Didn't work for me

review.reviewBody: There's a trick to wearing these shoes. When I first put them on they were extremely uncomfortable so I spent a day wearing them with socks. I'm so glad that I did because by day two I didn't need socks so I guess I broke them in. Now they are the most comfortable shoes ever! Keen is always good to me!
review.name: Give them a chance! You'll love these shoes!

name: Yogui Sandal - Women's

hasVariant.name: Del Dia Allpa 20L Travel Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Del Dia Allpa 20L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve loved my large Allpa for years but it’s too much for one or two nights. Finally ordered the 20L and I’m so happy with it! Perfect small size for an overnight trip. Love the addition of the water bottle side pocket
review.name: Perfect overnight bag

review.reviewBody:
This pack is just what ai wanted! A great size that fits my small frame without overwhelming me, but still has plenty of room for all the things I need for a couple of days!
I love the suitcase style for keeping things organized!
review.name: Perfection!

review.reviewBody: I originally bought this for traveling for my 9 year old but my 7 year old loved it. It’s perfect size and made very well. They both loved the bright colors.
review.name: The Perfect Size

review.reviewBody: It is very difficult to find a bag this exact size to be airplane compliant and be a clamshell backpack. Success.
review.name: Colorful backpack

review.reviewBody: Things marketed as diaper bags are super overpriced and generally in the form of a large handbag. We wanted something that was a backpack for more comfortable carrying. Enter this gem. It's the perfect size for a few changes of clothes, some toys, some snacks, a changing pad, diapers, and wipes while allowing us to be hands free and still hold the baby. Bonus points for the fact that it's not boring colors.
review.name: Perfect Size for Diaper Bag

review.reviewBody: We haven't used it yet but it appears to be as well made as the 28l and 35l Alpa travel packs I have and love. I believe this will be just the right size for my 10yo son to carry his stuff for a week long or more trip. He's excited to use it. I can update when we actually pack it to see how much it holds.
review.name: Alps 20l travel pack

review.reviewBody: I signed up for the email list for 20% off. I tried to use my code but I got an error that the code wasn’t available for this item. I emailed Cotopaxi but never heard back.
review.name: Mediocre ordering experience

review.reviewBody: I love my Mini Alpa. It is at the perfect size, so compact-able and easy to carry. Many hidden pockets allow you to hide critical items. Love the colors and simplicity of it.
review.name: Perfectly sized backpack

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love the Cotopaxi Allpa Mini 20L Travel Pack! It’s been a game-changer for me, especially when it comes to air travel. As someone who used to dread packing, this bag has made the process so much easier and more enjoyable. Its compact size fits perfectly as a personal item on flights, sliding effortlessly under the seat without feeling cramped.

The layout is incredibly thoughtful, with just the right number of compartments to keep everything organized without overcomplicating things. The water bottle holder deserves a special mention—it’s snug and securely held my Hydro Flask in place, which is something I’ve struggled to find in other bags.

If you’re looking for a travel pack that simplifies packing, keeps you organized, and fits seamlessly into your travel routine, the Cotopaxi Allpa Mini 20L is it. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect for Traveling!

review.reviewBody: I love Cotopaxi and we traveled complete New York with Cotopaxi such a friendly and travel experience and it allows you to carry 6 days clothes and we bought 3 bags for our family and my daughter was so happy with the bag and carried all day
review.name: Cotopaxi a travel companion

name: Del Dia Allpa 20L Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: I was excited about the one piece molded forefoot because the original drones were so bad with delaminating.  Unfortunately the fit on these is significantly worse.  The original drones would stretch and conform to your foot and these just don't.  All the little gaps and hot spots that existed the first time I tried them on still exist 15+ seasons in.  Another reviewer described them as feeling like a wooden shoe and I think that is perfect.  The stiff one piece forefoot feels like a barrier between your foot and the rock.  I entry is also smaller than the original making getting them on and off more challenging.  What a bummer.
review.name: Preferred the originals

review.reviewBody: I’ve been hunting for a stiff shoe that fits my small heels and this is a winner! Solutions are always too big, even the LV version. They run small so I had to exchange my first order, and the winning pair was still tough to get into at first, but after a few weeks they slip on like a dream. Half size up from my street shoe. I can stand on pebbles that would destroy my feet in my softer shoes, and they’re pretty comfortable to keep on for even a few attempts at a time!
review.name: Small heel, super stiff, perfect shoe.

review.reviewBody: I’ve never found an aggressive shoe that was confortable on the first day. I got the Drone 2.0s in my street shoe size (6.5, same as my original Drones). My toes reached the end of the shoe but weren’t smooshed. I hopped right on my projects in the gym and sent a couple, which is usually unheard of in brand new shoes. I took the Drone 2.0s outside and climbed a few hard routes without missing a beat. I love the design of these shoes and they edge perfectly. I’m going to be sticking with this model for a long time.
review.name: The most comfortable aggressive shoe!

name: Drone Low Volume 2.0 Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I've been a loyal fan of Mountain Hardware Dynama capris for years, and they have always been my go-to for just about everything. However, I'm quite disappointed with the new design. While I appreciate that they are still wearable, I noticed that this latest pair runs a bit larger than my previous ones, making them look quite baggy on me. 

One of the most baffling changes is the removal of the functional pocket on the left thigh, which was perfect for holding a phone. Instead, they've added a non-functional pocket on the right side that can barely fit a driver's license. This change results in three pockets on one side, which, when used, makes the pants uneven and causes them to pull down on that side.

Whoever thought this redesign was a good idea clearly didn't consider functionality. I didn't realize the design had changed and washed them before inspecting and trying them on so I am stuck with my new pair and hoping for the best, but I sincerely hope Mountain Hardware reconsiders these changes in future versions.
review.name: Disappointing Redesign: Larger Fit and Less Functional Pockets

review.reviewBody: I have been buying Dynama capris for many years.  My least favorite version was the Dynama 2 since they seemed a little low in the rise and the side pockets stuck out on me.  These new ones are a smoother fit and I like them much better.  I have gotten two pairs and I would say they run a bit larger than the older versions.  I hope they come out in a grey color.
review.name: Good Update!

review.reviewBody: I just got my third pair (second black ones). So light and comfy and nice pockets!
review.name: I loved in these this summer!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable fit and practical with hand and phone pockets. I like the sun protection fabric and bit of extra coverage versus a pair of shorts.

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for a month long trip to Africa and it worked wonderfully! I stuffed a months-worth of clothes, shoes and bedding in this bag and it held up through multiple airports as a checked bag. The zippers are very strong and durable and the internal mesh pouch with zippers helped with organization. The three external handles make it easy to maneuver and pack and the backpack straps are comfortable even with over 40 lbs of weight in the bag. Would definitely recommend!
review.name: Comfortable, Durable, and Spacious

name: Ranger 90L Duffel

review.reviewBody: I bought these shorts in a blue size 2 some time ago. They fit perfectly and are very comfortable so I was excited to find them in the burnt sienna color. The pairs are exactly the same according to the label but the new ones I got feel almost a size smaller. I re-ordered them in the size 4 to see how they fit.
review.name: variance in sizing between colors

review.reviewBody: Like most reviews say, I did size up.  But even then the rise is still too short and I get uncomfortable tugging at my crotch.  Too bad because the are soft, stretchy, the right length and attractive otherwise!
review.name: Almost perfect shorts

review.reviewBody:
After reading previous reviews on these shorts running a size small, I purchased a 6 (I typically wear a 4, sometimes a 2). Glad I did! They fit perfectly. Not too snug or loose. For reference, I'm 5'6 and 125 pounds.

I love the fabric, feel, and the pockets!
review.name: Glad I sized up!

review.reviewBody: I am a fairly normal athletically shaped person and almost always wear a size 2.  These shorts fit great except for the rise. The rise was too short. Sad because I love the cotton and everything else about the short.
review.name: Rise too short

name: Credo Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: The hat is so lovely and will last forever. I ran into a few issues and Backcountry was quick to fix it and very responsive. I highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: I am in the middle of the large size section and it is too small. It also came smelling weird and seems thin and light.

review.reviewBody: Returned because size did not match the chart provided.

review.reviewBody: Just received my hat and even though I measured my head AND consulted with a gearhead,the medium was WAY too small for me.My head measures 22.5 inches (not pulled tight) and I am a seamstress so am very confident in my measurements.A medium should have been perfect.Hopefully sizing up to a large will solve the problem because the hat itself is great and just what I was looking for.
review.name: Runs SMALL

review.reviewBody: This hat is everything I wanted: crushable, medium brim, leather strap, and fashionable. Based on my measurements, I went with a size small and it fits perfectly. I wouldn’t change a thing!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
Truly awesome hat and superb quality.
Fits true to size if you follow the fitting guide.
Great for rain & sun with great anti sweat headband.
Full leather neck cord to secure or have on your back.
Will only improve with age and so glad I purchased.
Couldn’t have bought anything better!
Highly recommend this hat and the quality of service from Backcountry…. 7 days shipping to NZ.
review.name: Best Hat Ever!!!!

review.reviewBody: I?m not sure if we got a defectively sized version of this hat, or what, but the size medium in this hat fits truly like a small. We even measured my girlfriend?s head and this was the case. It?s a nice looking hat but was too tight for her.
review.name: Fit was very small

description: Buy the Deuter Speed Lite 21L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Speed Lite 21L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Speed Lite 21L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is very well made and a quality product. Very lightweight, which is so important when toting things around while hiking. It's a beautiful color and the construction looks like it will hold up for many years to come.
review.name: Great Quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received my backpack and put it to good use.  Went hiking and couldn't believe how comfortable the backpack was.   The straps were strong and soft.  I was also impressed by the quality and amount of room that was in it.  Love it
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this backpack to use when I hike with my Girl Scouts. It it lightweight and comfortable to wear. Is has just the right amount of space to hols the paperwork I have to carry, a first aid kit, a light jacket, and snacks. It is a well constructed backpack made with quality materials.
review.name: Perfect for a light hike

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this backpack. It’s incredibly light and looks great. The 4 loops on the outside of the backpack are perfect for small carabiners to hold my climbing shoes, keys, helmet or any other belongings. I wish the top, open piece opened though because it would prefect to cinch down a rope. But I use it for dirty gym clothes after a training session. Something else that would make this pack perfect is deeper side pockets because my 24 hydro flask doesn’t fit. Bladder pouch comes in handy for that reason. High quality from deuter!
review.name: Fantastic backpack for climbing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very nice back pack and it is perfect for any outdoor activity since there are many areas to keep things separated.  It is very light weight and easy to put on and adjust.  Seems very durable also.
review.name: very nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I rather like my Deuter - Speed Lite 21 pack. It's light, easy, and durable. My favorite parts are the straps (which fasten things in place) and the small pocket at the top (perfect for small and easy access of things like your phone, headset, and keys). The color is a nice cherry on top!
review.name: Light, Easy, and Durable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect sized bag for a quick hike. Carries the essentials and is very lightweight. Even looks good and not tacky! The first aid compartment is a life saver… literally! If going on a long hike I recommend a larger bag.
review.name: Lightweight!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is really lightweight and a great size for half day hikes and general day use. It wears comfortably and the back is padded and breathable. It fits my frame well as a 5’3” female. I am pretty picky with the weight of empty packs and this is truly lightweight. It feels like nothing when worn. I love that the inside of the main compartment has a label with some first aid information. It is basic information, but very nice to have if the situation ever arises. There is a small top compartment that can hold keys, valuables, and other small items that you need easy access to. The outer pocket is spacious and feels secure. The pocket is formed by the dark and light colorblocked panels where the logo is. The two panels are connected and you just slip your items inside.  It is easy to put stuff in it, but I do wish to be able to open it up fully with a buckle or through other means. If I could change one thing, it would be to have taller water bottle side pockets. I have a 24oz bottle that is around 10 inches tall. While it technically fits, it does not feel secure enough. The pockets are better suited for shorter water bottles.
review.name: Incredibly lightweight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is just perfect for any of my outdoor activities. Nice and roomy inside with plenty of small compartments. Used it for 4th of July parades and fireworks. Nice padded straps so very comfortable to carry. I highly recommend it and I will be using it frequently.
review.name: Perfect accessory for me!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is great and is extremely lightweight. It seems small but I can fit three days work of clothing and essentials in it. The buckle on the front is small so it doesn’t interfere or pull on your clothing.
Highly recommend!
review.name: Lightweight

name: Speed Lite 21L Backpack

review.reviewBody: It looks nicer than the pictures. The interior seams are finished, interior pocket, adjustable hem elastic, zipper exterior pocket, high collar and a fitted hood. As always, I’m impressed with the quality of these products. I am 5’2” and 112 pounds. The bottom is a little wide, and the sleeves a little long, but the snap closure on the sleeves and the elastic around the bottom bring those things in fine. I see complaints on the width of the sleeves, I have larger biceps, and this isn’t an issue for me.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Very durable and I really like it! I am excited to take this on hikes this summer.
I am extremely pleased with this jacket.  This light weight jacket keeps you warm in those cool days.  Definitely a must have.
review.name: Best jacket!

review.reviewBody: I am 5’7 and normally a size 10 (UK) or 36/38 (EU). I am slim but have quite broad shoulders and slim hips. I ordered the S and M but the M fits better around my back and shoulders. However, the bottom of the jacket flares out and would look better on someone with curves! You can pull the jacket in at the hem using toggles though, which works well. I also like the long sleeves. The hood could be better if it was adjustable, but it’s a decent size. Overall, really nice and I’m looking forward to wearing it.
review.name: Stina Jacket

review.reviewBody: Best everyday jacket ever staple piece that I wear almost daily! Side note I tend to be sweaty and this jacket doesn’t smell or hold stink like some of my other clothes.
review.name: Great for stinky girls

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket since I did not have a casual outdoor jacket. I originally followed the advice of one reviewer who indicated not to size up, this was a mistake as the chest was too small and I could not fit a heavier layer underneath so had to exchange for a medium. So go by the size guide if you are ordering. For reference, I am 5’7, 134 lbs, 36 chest - The bottom is wide so I wish it was narrower, there is a drawstring but it would be more flattering if it did not flare out as much as it does. Overall, super nice jacket.
review.name: Nice casual jacket

review.reviewBody: Very nice fitting and classy jacket. Looks practical and stylish at the same time. Looks way better in-person than in the photos. Nice fabric, too.
review.name: Classy Jacket

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’6, 125 lbs and I usually wear an XS or S in Fjallraven jackets and tops, however, this Stina jacket ran extremely small on me so I am exchanging it for a medium so I can comfortably wear a flannel shirt under the jacket.  I have the Nuuk parka in an XS it is generous in size and I have the latte jacket and a down jacket in a small and they both fit perfect.  As always, the quality and color are beautiful!
review.name: Beautiful jacket but runs small!

review.reviewBody: I usually order XL in everything  but found this jacket didn’t fit as the arms were too tight for my muscular arms. Nice Long sleeves but tight fit. Disappointed
review.name: Doesn’t fit muscular biceps

review.reviewBody: Perfect fall jacket, exactly what I was looking for and does not look like a shiny rain jacket. However, I listened to the other reviewers and sized up; I would NOT recommend doing this, it ended up being huge on me even with a thick hoodie underneath so I will be exchanging. (5’6 135lb, purchased a medium and returning for a small).
review.name: Don’t size up!

name: Stina Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've had this helmet for a while now and it's very comfortable. I always forget it's on when I hit rest stops
review.name: Excellent helmet

review.reviewBody: Small is too small and medium too large  not the mips lasers none for
review.name: Helmet size not very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Hard to give it a review that'll work for everyone, but I'll try to make it generic so it helps more people.

Sizing is spot on.  I have a 59.5cm head, ordered a large, I have room to go both ways with the adjustments, so that's good for winter riding when I have a skull cap under there, and in the warmer weather after I freshly buzz my head.  

Adjustments are easy, no dial on the back like I'm used to, it's more like a large strap on the back/top of the helmet.  You rotate it either way and it snugs down.  There is also a positioning mechanism inside that will move the rear head brace up or down depending on how you want the helmet to sit on your head.  

The straps and the adjusting sliders are great, they didn't move yet after I set them (ridden the helmet of course to confirm).  That's actually nice, I hate when stuff moves and I end up fiddling around every couple rides to get it all back.  

The helmet doesn't seem loud or quiet, it's just right in the middle.  I always hope for a quiet helmet, something that baffles the air in just such a way that you don't endlessly sound like you're in a hurricane.  This one is neither, so it's fine there.

The sweat pads aren't the best.  It was 65 and sunny the last time I rode it, and the sweat was running down my face and into my eyes.  I'm slightly worried about the hot 90+ degree days I have waiting for me, but horses for courses, I'll just use my other helmet as a backup if it's a problem.  I can't ding it a star here, look at it, it doesn't have a million vents like the other style helmets, so of course it won't flow as much air.  I knew this going into it, so just noting.  

Fit overall on my oval shaped head is dead on, I'm fine in whatever, but it does seem to not move at all nor do I get pressure points from having it snuggly sitting on my head (like it should).

Not sure about the effectiveness of the crumple zone helmet, I'd have to see it done on a crash test dummy to really believe it, but it does make more sense than the MIPS system to me.  

Weight is fine too, I didn't weigh it but my neck feels just fine after riding.  If I get to the point that I can't ride my bike because my helmet is too heavy I got bigger issues.

One thing - there's no good spot to really put your sunglasses if you want to flip them up and wipe your eyes or get some air.  They sit in the intended slots not super great, that's something you get more choice with when you get a non-aero helmet.  Not a big deal, throw them in your jersey or hook on the front.

Aesthetically, I like it too.  I got black, nice and simple.  

That's about it.  Good helmet, does what I ask of it, and if I ever need to REALLY use it, there's a crash replacement program you can choose to use from Lazer, which is nice when you pony up almost 300 bucks for something these days.
review.name: Fits like a glove

review.reviewBody: I'm a medium in Bell and Giro, but apparently not in Lazar.  If you're on the border, order up a size.
review.name: Runs Small
comment: You gave it three stars because you ordered a size too small?
Hi Matthew - Thank you for your review.  If you need help facilitating a return or exchange please reach out , i would be happy to assist.

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased this hat when visiting the Big Bend area and I love it. It fits perfectly and is true to size. I was looking for a light weight stiff brimmed hat for sun protection and this one was just right.
review.name: No regret purchase

review.reviewBody: Love this hat, fits perfectly, strap works great on windy day, and an adjustable headband used during winter or summer months.I have purchased four over the past eight years for different venues.
review.name: Charter Hat

review.reviewBody: After trying several wide brim sun hats, I found this one in a local sporting goods store on Cape Cod.  It is ideally crafted and was admired by the captain on a spectator vessel at Americas Cup finals in Barcelona in September. He said he had tried to find one of similar design with stiff brim, SPF protection and was comfortable.  There was nothing he could find like it in Europe.  Being the generous sea-faring man that I am, I gave it to him at the end of the trip.  The captain was extremely grateful and other passengers that day were impressed. As soon as I got back, I popped for a replacement from the website.
review.name: Ideal hat for sailing on sunny days.

review.reviewBody: Great fitting hat! I get lots of compliments on my hat. It provides great sun protection while remaining cool. This is my second of this hat. No need to keep looking👍🏼
review.name: Great Hat!

review.reviewBody: I love this hat. Very comfortable and looks great too. I like how it packs flat and doesn’t crease. A good purchase for sun protection!
review.name: Very comfortable stylish hat!

review.reviewBody:
Ive had mine 5 years and its still the best hat ever. Not only that, i get plenty of compliments on its style.
Its also great to take into the pool with me.
review.name: Best hat ever!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: I am a professional outdoor shooting sports referee.  I work many sunny days in both moderate and hot humid weather.  The Charter Hat was the best investment I made to protect head/face/neck from 8 hour daily sun exposure.  Comfortable and good looking.  Do not machine wash - a simple solution of Dawn liquid soap/water using a soft toothbrush does the trick.  Rinse and dry in the sun.
review.name: Superb Outdoor Sun Hat

review.reviewBody: Great hat! However, it could use 2 air vents on each side to add additional cooling.
review.name: Needs...

review.reviewBody: My husband has the Solar Bucket hat (in multiple colors), but needed a wider brimmed hat.  I ordered the Charter Hat and he loves it!  The brim is wide, but not too wide and the style is very smart!  We love Sunday Afternoons hats!!!  Top quality!
review.name: Terrific Hat - my husband loves it!

review.reviewBody: Purchased ten years ago and worn daily throughout the summer months boating, hiking, gardening,, and touring. Very comfortable, cooling, and fantastic sun protection. This is my favorite sun hat and I have a large collection to choose from.
review.name: Best sun hat ever.

I have a very round head and when I tried on a Large size helmet, I was getting hot spots on my head. Going one size up resolved that and the XL helmet doesn't feel big at all. review.reviewBody: After 1k with no problems, the rear tire had a side wall puncture after sliding into a treacherous divot. I replaced it with the same tire. That should say something about my confidence in the product.
review.name: Nice tire

review.reviewBody:
Have had two sets of 700x25mm tanwalls that blew off the rim while set up tubeless. This being on a hooked rim - specifically a Hunt that uses the H-Lock bead to really get tubeless tires seated. They are also stupidly tight and one tire actually had to be cut off because levers couldn't get underneath it even after it was punctured.

I wouldn't wish these tires on Hitler. They're just so stupidly bad.
review.name: Terrible, awful, dangerous tires

review.reviewBody: I have now used Schwalbe Pro 1, GP 5000 TL, and Pirelli PZero Race TLR. These were by far and away the thinnest of the bunch. They felt supple on the road and I enjoy running them at low pressure. I do not have Enve Wheels so it is hard to say if they would work better on the rims they are designed for. I had a blowout flat going 35+ mph downhill only 290 miles into using these tires. I would not recommend these tires. They are definitely of lesser quality than the GP 5000 and Pirelli
review.name: Super Thin

review.reviewBody:
I road Specialized Turbos for years. They wear out so fast and the sidewalls are like tissue paper. Flats and cuts and no durability. 

These tires are so smooth and fast. I love the tan sidewalls. 

They run big though. A layer of tape around the rim bed helps them grab to seat. 

Highly recommend.
review.name: Fast

review.reviewBody: I have the tan side walled ENVE SES tires (size 29) mounted on a new pair of ENVE SES 3.4 AR Disc Carbon rims.  This is my first tubeless setup and my first set of carbon rims.  WOW, what a set up!  I have never mounted tubeless tires.  I followed the video on the ENVE website and had ZERO issues.  I did have to go to my bike shop so I could get enough pressure to "snap" the tires in place.  My floor pump was not enough.  That was on me, not the tires.  I ride on paved roads 100% of the time.  I do live in the Midwest.  Numerous potholes, un even pavement, and many small branches have been ridden over.  I hope I do not jinx myself, no flats!  Oh and by the way, I weigh 195 lbs.   I would recommend this tire 100%!
review.name: Great Tires!  1500 miles and counting

review.reviewBody:
Combined with G23 wheels w Chris king ceramic hubs as a climbing setup. 
These things haul @$$.  Great job Enve. 

Listen to the 1 star reviews though so I can keep them in stock for myself!
review.name: Best, Fastest, Period.

review.reviewBody:
These tires are awesome! Running them at 55psi and it's like riding on a cloud.

Some people should learn how to setup tubeless before complaining about them. It's a process to be learned and these tires aren't any different to others I've tried (Cadex/Schwalbe).

Almost 500 miles in and they've held up perfectly. Was tight getting on but that's all tubeless tires (soapy water people). Anyway, would you rather they be loose and blow off? Enve's sealed up well after 24hrs with sealant inside. Does need to be topped off with air every 48hrs or so since they're at a lower pressure (55psi for me) and they're tubeless.

Also ignore the flat blamers on the tires. If you don't drive race tires through glass/holes they'll last and you won't get flats.

Coming from Cadex tires to these was a game changer. If you're on hookless wheels getcha some!
review.name: Great Tire, very fast and comfortable
comment:
Thanks for the review.  Got a set of these coming 700x31 to mount up on Zipp 303 Firecrest Disc hookless rims.  We'll see how they mount up but as you say, with the right process, shouldn't be an issue.  Am interested to see how they perform.  Used to GP5000's and Schwalbe One's.

Couldn't agree more on the road hazards issue, if you want supple and fast then don't run over a lot of glass, metal and other sharp road detritus, and try not to hammer through square edged potholes.  Personally I'd rather have the grip, feel, and speed of a good race tire, I always carry a tube or two in case of a flat that won't seal.

review.reviewBody: absolutely the worst mounting tubeless tire n the market. I tried to mount on brand new Enve 3.4 SES wheels built by Wheelbuilder. Spent/wasted 3 hrs of my life trying to get these to insufflate.
review.name: the WORST!
comment: Sorry these tires didn't work out for you.  Feel free to give us a call next time for some other Gearhead recommendations.   Our experts are here to help, call us and we will take care of you.1-888-276-7130

review.reviewBody: After doing lots of research, I think Enve has put a lot of research and thought into these tires. With all the fear, uncertainty and doubt around tubeless, I feel this is the best option to ride with a high quality product that gives me peace of mind. They roll well and I have no complaints. Sure, they were hard to put in, just like all the other tubeless I've used before. With a bit of powder and patience it's relatively straightforward.
review.name: Great job, Enve

review.reviewBody: Been riding Specialized Turbos with tubes for the last year and never had a flat. Ride one with these Enve?s and I get a flat. Guess I shouldn?t have tried a new product without some further testing from the cycling community first. Additionally, they were a royal pain in the ass to install on Enve?s own wheels!
review.name: Flat on the first ride

name: SES Tubeless Road Tire
