review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
The tongue on the left shoe was made wrong with too much fabric. It gathers and creates a bump that digs painfully into your foot when your shoe is tied. The difference between the correctly made right shoe and the wrong left shoe is very obvious. Very disappointed Keen would sell a defective item. 

I own a previous version of the Targhee and they were absolutely perfect. I wore them constantly for 5 years. This version is also too big and wide. Very disappointed.
review.name: Painful shoe because of defect

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The tongue had a bump that made the shoe very uncomfortable. The fit otherwise was good.
review.name: The tongue had a bump

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been out in all kinds of terrain since I got my boots. They are very stable and comfortable, and I’m appreciating the wide toe box.
review.name: Love my Targhee IVs

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
The Targhee IIV fit perfectly. So nice to have the width back. I have been wearing Keen’s for years because I have small wide feet. The last two pairs I had to take to a shoe shop to be stretched. This new pair fit amazing.
Thank you
review.name: The Targhee IIV fit perfectly.

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore these shoes during a Disaster Relief time in GA. I received them on Wednesday and was deployed on Thursday until the next Thursday night. I put them on Thursday morning and was able to wear them every day from 4 am to 7:30 pm! They were super comfortable & even though I was on a concrete base, I was able to make it just fine in these shoes. I can’t wait to really go outdoors in them!
review.name: Super Shoe!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these shorts. In fact, I wish there were more colors so I could buy them. I'm 5'6, 130 lbs, and if you're a long torsoed girlie like me these shorts will change your life. review.reviewBody: I am approximately 150-155 pounds, 5’6 height. I typically wear a medium, an occasional large for tighter clothing. I did size up to XL in these based on the sizing reviews. review.reviewBody: The outer material on this jacket has a strange plastic feel to it.  It doesn't really block the wind, which is ultimately its first and most important function.  It's second function is to move moisture from your body to the outer layer.  Failed there as well.  I am drenched within the first thirty minutes. review.reviewBody: Bought the 210 Short divider for my Tundra.  Well it's good, just not great.  Maybe my expectations were higher than the products capabilities.  So I loaded up the 210 Tundra for a family vacation, I wanted to use the short divider to make two compartments.  One side was going to be ice, the other side for food/condiments.  I loaded up approximately  100lbs of ice (5-20lb loads of bulk ice), drove home to start loading my truck for the trip.  When I got to loading the food I noticed the divider was bowing due to the weight of the ice I loaded previously.  While the divider was inserted correctly into the Tundra slots I never expected the ice weight to bow the divider.    I do think the divider could be engineered with a bit more gussets to prevent the bowing.  Maybe even using a bit stouter material that can hold the load of the ice.  Yea...I could have used the ice blocks or other "reusable" style ice blocks but I wanted to see what the capacity of the 210 Tundra was for ice.  I will continue to use the divider, the 210 held "ice" for at least 5-6 days afterwards.   Just $.02 from a Yeti user.
review.name: Divider is good, just not perfect/great

review.reviewBody: It works !. Diet coke on one side other drinks over there with ice.
review.name: Road trip to Ocala , fla.

review.reviewBody: Used it once. While it divided, it does not keep water out. Not sure why I expected it too but water tight divider would be a huge help.

review.reviewBody: The 35/45 short wasn't even close to fitting my Tundra 45. The divider seems to be manufactured about 1 inch too big to even start getting into the cooler.
review.name: Not Even Close to Fitting

review.reviewBody: The divider fit well length wise, but is too tall. Lid will not close completely.

review.reviewBody: I just bought a Tundra short divider for my tundra 45. It does not fit. When I tried to put it in it went in about half way and started to bend and almost got stuck. When I tried to pull it out I picked up the whole cooler by the divider. I had to put my foot on the cooler to get it out. The divider measures 11 1/8 inches at the bottom and 12 5/16 inches at the top. Is the divider too big or the cooler too small. Please help!
review.name: Divider won't fit

review.reviewBody: This fits like it should. Very happy, I am not sure what else I need to say about it.
review.name: Tundra Divider

review.reviewBody: First, pair of ultras. Used as daily road running. They replaced my saucony tempus. Thus far big fan of altras. Toe box is a game changer. Have a little roll when running that feels nice.
review.name: 20 miles in

review.reviewBody: Training runs. Just the right cushion with a nice bit of responsiveness. Ran 740k in FWD Experience and jumped straight into Flow. Excellent shoes.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Great wide toe box, light shoes, comfortable fit. Great for daily trainers and affordable too. Would recommend to anyone.
review.name: Great fit, light weight, perfect daily trainers

review.reviewBody: I'll admit that I have always thought Altra shoes were not for me. Between the squared off toe box and the zero drop DNA; I just never gave them a chance. That all changed when they came out with the Experience collection and the move to a mid-drop ALTernative. I rushed to my local running store to try on a pair even though I didn't really even need new shoes. That 5 minute walk around the store was all it took. I am a convert - 100%. These shoes feel wonderful. No more hot spots. I can fit lightweight socks for speedwork and thicker cushion for long runs. I've started with the road shoes but you can probably guess what my next trail shoes will be!
review.name: First time customer - what have I been waiting for...

review.reviewBody: After years of running to Torins and Riveras, the Experience Flow has become my new "go to" road running shoe. Excellent fit, comfort, and style!
review.name: Another new excellent model in Altra's lineup!

review.reviewBody: Ultraflow experience shoes are very very comfortable great size great fit the only gripe that I have with the issue is that the tongue should have been put in place it likes to slide back and forth even though the laces are in that little hole on the tongue it's still slides back and forth other than that it's an awesome shoe
review.name: I'd buy again

review.reviewBody: I have a wide foot and because of the toe box design on these shoe I feel great wearing them.
review.name: No pain no gain. But honestly I feel no pain in these

review.reviewBody: I think these are my favorite running shoes so far. My only issues are that they feel a little narrow and small(I guess most altras are narrow now). With that said, I needed to go up a half size from 8.5 to a 9. The heel lockdown feels not the best on a 9 but feels great on a 8.5. I wish there was slightly more room in the toebox as well. Someone else mentioned that they had issues with their pinky toe and I also have issues with my pinky toe being squished in these shoes. Other than that I think these shoes are great.
review.name: Almost the perfect shoe

review.reviewBody: Roughly 200 mi so far worth of running in them with little to no tread wear, If they hold true to the brand they will last about another 300 mi before I stopped training in them and they transitioned into streetwear shoes And
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: I bought these after a 5k trial run offered by my local store because i adored the way they felt. Once receiving my pair there was noticeable discomfort on my lateral ball point on my right foot (the knuckle behind my pinkie toe). This is slightly common with shoes for me, it takes a small break in period usually. I have run maybe 30 miles in these since April due to pain avoidance and have just kept primarily running in my Hoka Arahi's. Having a race come up i decided to finally just commit to breaking these in and ran 4 back to back 5k's this week, modifying my gate so it didn't aggravate my LBP, and today, immediately after my run i have searing pain in my right foot at the oblique head area and am afraid i will have to miss my anticipated charity run. I know this could be due to my own anatomy but i wanted to provide a cautionary tale for bigfoots like me.
review.name: Lateral Ball Point Discomfort

name: Experience Flow Running Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the USWE Outlander 9L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I picked up a USWE Outlander 3 at a LBS after trying it on.  I wasn't sure how the No Dancing Monkey straps would work out for a smaller guy, but found them quite simple to adjust, and both comfortable and stable.  Not sure how this would apply for a female with a more ample chest, as it wasn't a great fit for my wife.  Bottom line, the unique straps system works well for me, although it's not anthing revolutionary, and may not be ideal for everyone.  

The 3L version is just too small for many of my rides, and while great for short mild temp rides, it just didn't have the room for enough water or any extra layers beyond a very compact wind shell along with my tools.

This 9L version has adequate capacity for most of my rides, with a 3L bladder, and room for tools and a first aid kit, along with a modest number of layers.  There is also a small phone pocket that could also fit some snacks.

The only thing to keep in mind with USWE is that the volume capacity includes the bladder, so size up compared to an Osprey or CamelBak.  This 9L pack holds about the same amount of water and stuff that my Osprey Viper 3 held.

Finally kudos to USWE for including some bright colors in their selection.  I am almost exclusively a mountain biker, but often have to hop on a road during a ride.  The orange is also a nice choice when riding during hunting season.  Not getting shot or run over takes precednce over wearing a more fashionable muted shade, although they offer basic black for those who prefer to ride stealth.
review.name: Versatile Pack

review.reviewBody: Seriously, I am a huge fan of this pack. I have been riding longer and longer rides, to where I mount (2) 1L bottles and (1) 600ml bottle and that wasn't enough. Add this USWE pack and I added 2 L more fluid to my rides. I could put 3L in the pack, but 2 lets me have plenty of storage for a first aid kit, Gilet, Jacket, tools, my inreach and more then enough nutrition for my 100 mile gravel adventures. the added bonus is the hydro pack spout for quick sips without reaching for a bottle.
review.name: The perfect Pack!

review.reviewBody: The pack its self is very nice really light and doesn’t move around. The only complaint I have is on the water pack where the hose goes in, doesn’t stay in it, it likes to pop out very easy and the water fills up inside. Wish there was a better connection for it.
review.name: Fits good

review.reviewBody: I can’t believe people ride without this bag! It holds a lot of water, more than enough for a full day out on the trails. It has a phone pocket, tool loops inside, and still space for snacks while you’re out. The best part about this bag is that it truly doesn’t move! It stays secure to your chest while hitting jumps and doesn’t bounce around on trails in anyway. Highly recommend this to any rider.
review.name: Amazing bag!

name: Outlander 9L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: I love these! I bought for bike riding during the winter and I have no complaints. Now of course I pair with a base layer, jacket, good gloves, and warm socks, but these have treated me well with temps 15-30 degrees. I have no problem staying warm and they do a fine job with the wind.
review.name: Sturdy product!

review.reviewBody:
As other reviews have stated, these aren't very warm.  I've found they perform best in 40-50F.  I've sometimes added a thin base layer or ski socks to add a little more insulation as weather has dictated.  They are not wind-proof!  All that being said, in the months I've had them I've gotten tons of use out of them, both on road and on trails. The shoulder straps and chamois are comfy.  
Don't buy these thinking they'll be all you need in freezing temps.  If you're more of a fair weather rider, I think you'll like them.
review.name: Good for chilly weather, not cold

review.reviewBody: Fabric is not wind proof.  Riding with the temperature in the 40s, my quads were freezing. Fabric is slippery so, except when hunkered down in the drops, I was sliding around on the saddle. Shoulder straps are comfortable.
review.name: Not warm

review.reviewBody: I purchased these because I trusted the Gore name. I"m disappointed.  They're pretty lightweight and the chamois isn't the greatest.  I was expecting a heavier, warmer product.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love 3 in 1 jackets. They are very versatile, and allow you to add or subtract layers based on the current weather without having to bring three separate jackets because who has space and time for that! It already has effectively kept me warm during freezing temperatures, and dry from sudden sprinkles of rain. I love the color - subtle enough for that everyday cute look, but bright enough to stand out if someone is looking for you. The only thing is that I wish that the inner layer was thicker and more plush - something difficult to convey online. This jacket should last me a while, but I would definitely buy again.

review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves based on the sizing chart. In fact I like my gloves a little bit loose so I bought one size bigger than the chart suggested. How are the fit was extremely tight. Need to size up on these gloves. Otherwise quality of the glove seem very good. I don't have big hands. Bought a large.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody:
I've had these since March 2016 and I'm still using them.  Ski mainly in VT/NH and up until last year they were still fairly warm, but I just bought a pair of 3-Finger ones.  I've used these everywhere from Utah, Rogers Pass, Revelstoke, you name it.  They're fairly water proof (I did wax them up every year) but they definitely are NOT like Gore-Tex, but I think that's OK.  If anything, I sweat in them more than they get wet from the outside.  They have great dexterity and I couldn't be happier with them.  The only cut I got in them was from a beer-league race ski and that was about 5 years ago.  It hasn't grown at all, and I should probably patch it up at some point.
I got a size 10 and they fit me perfect, so I'm not sure if the fit is tight or not to be honest.  I'm getting a 10 and 11 in the new ones to try out.

I've also found that the Goat Leather in these takes the waxing better than the cow leather in my other Hestra gloves.  Maybe I did something wrong, but these went back to the normal suppleness of the leather while being more water proof.  My other cow leather ones got kind of stiff.
review.name: Amazing Gloves!

review.reviewBody: I went into a store and tried on a Hestra Men's size 9 and they fit great.  My brother has these exact gloves in a size 9 and they fit me perfect so I decided to buy some.  These gloves show up and they look like childrens gloves.  No way in heck my hands even come close to fitting inside them.  What in the world is going on Backcountry ?  The label on the gloves says "Unisex" yet this listing for the product says, "Mens"...  was there a mix up ?   The size says, "L9". Is that ladies ?  Couldnt be more disappointed because now I am forced to pay return shipping.
review.name: Sizing is WILDLY off

review.reviewBody: When it comes to ski gloves, this is the gold standard and has been for years. Warm, supple and dexterous. I have been on the snow about 75-100 days/year for the past 20 years, and the vertical cut has always been my go-to hand cover of choice. I easily get 250-300 days out of a pair with no rips, holes or issues of any kind. Put them on in the AM and leave them on all day. No need to take them off to grab things with surgical precision while on the hill. Sure, during 15"+ storm days, I do like the extra cuff that comes with the Army Leather glove. But, the AL gloves are no where near as supple. If you need freedom of movement and warmth, look no further.
review.name: Best Ski Gloves EVER

name: Vertical Cut CZone Glove

The silicone cleans so easily and there's no fear of dropping these bowls. I have a different color and am planning to get more. review.reviewBody: Do not purchase
review.name: Bad

review.reviewBody: These are by far the most comfortable bibs I have ever worn.  Great for spin class or century rides.  I could go on and on and on....
review.name: The MOST comfortable Bibs

review.reviewBody: It feels like I'm not wearing anything when I have these on which is very different than the rest of my bibs. They are great indoors and outdoors; however, if you prefer the nice compression fit that other bibs provide, steer clear.
review.name: Good bib but different

review.reviewBody: They fit like a garment bag and the material is sketchy.  Returned.
review.name: Don't recommend

review.reviewBody:
I own 2 pairs of C5 bib shorts+, and a pair of c7 bib shorts+. I've owned them for about 2-3 years.  I love them. They are quality, and you immediately feel the high quality when you put them on. They still look relatively new, and feel just as great.

I recently bought a pair of c5 optiline (red band/accents at bottom of shorts). It's as if a different company made these shorts. You immediately feel the low quality when you put them on. The fabric is too stretchy, and the red band/accent on legs immediately lost their shape and look like an old cotton shirt that has completely lost its shape after less than 2-3 months of wearing them. The chamois is thin, and not comfortable at all. Because the whole bib short is too stretchy, it doesn't stay in place when you're riding, and it feels like you're swimming inside the shorts. 

Don't buy the optiline.
review.name: These are subpar

review.reviewBody: The fit and material is very nice for this price point.  However, for cyclists who do a fair amount of mileage, this chamois simply will not cut it.  If they upgrade the chamois to match Pearl Izumi or Castelli's top-of-the-line chamois, I'm in.  Serious cyclists will require a better chamois, but great bib for recreational cyclists.
review.name: Nice bib, chamois needs upgrading

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'2" / 185 lbs / 34" inseam / 40" chest and the XL fits like it was poured on. For the short ride I used them for they were great. I'll update this once I get 40-50 miles but am expecting to be very happy from initial impressions.
review.name: Initial impressions are Great

review.reviewBody:
I ordered this bib in M and L. The large chamois sat like a diaper and was obviously too big. Medium fit like a glove. It sits where it needs to be and doesn't move when you walk. The bib starts just above the knee and isn't overly tight yet doesn't have any movement when riding. The shoulder straps are wide, soft and don't have an uncomfortable pull.

There is no "cup" cut out that may seem that exists in the photos. Thats just the way stitching comes together and is an optical illusion in the photo. They did place a piece of fabric between the outer bib and the chamois over the groin area to block the wind and it work really well. However, don't expect a special cup cut out for your junk. Unfortunately everything gets compressed like in all the other bibs.

Overall, the material sits tight and doesn't move. I'm average build and unlike Castelli bibs, where I need to order 2 sizes up, this one truly fits for an average US male. I was comfortable in this chamois on multiple 30 mile rides and had no issues.
review.name: American Fit

review.reviewBody: What a great pair of bib shorts. I'm 5' 8" and the length of the legs was perfect: Just above the knee when standing. Light compression and very comfortable. I wanted something with some "styling" and the white accents on the legs fit my interests. Great shammy. Highly recommend you consider these bib shorts.
review.name: Excellent Bibs - Highly Recommend

name: C5 Optiline Bib Short+ - Men's

description: Buy the Deuter Freerider Pro 34L+ Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Freerider Pro 34L+ Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Freerider Pro 34L+ Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have had this bag for several seasons and I can say that it is extremely durable, extremely comfortable, and extremely versatile. In summary: if you buy this, you will not regret it. It is as good or better than any other bag I have had the chance to play with. The best features are the harness, which is comfortable up to 30lbs; the expansion collar, which I have used to either create more internal space or to create a shelf in the zipped area above the main compartment - genius design; and the back panel entry, which is useful for more than just skiing/climbing - I used this pack as my onebag for a two-week trip to Portugal. Genuinely, I love this backpack.

I have 3 main complaints but they are small and arranged in decreasing importance.

1. The roll-top collar is not shaped properly. They needed to flare the collar at an angle to give adequate dimensions for it to function as intended. It still works, but you definitely find that you are constrained once you roll the top enough to make sure it is properly sealed.

2. The diagonal carry is not....great. It works, but it is not much faster than A-frame and it is less comfortable. In a perfect world, you should be able to transition to/from diagonal carry without removing your pack, but here you must. That having been said, in all but most skimo racing packs, you have to remove your pack to do diagonal carry anyway, so this is a wash. Personally, I would like a dedicated accessory for diagonal carry that makes it easier to deploy without removing your pack - I would pay more money for the add-on. I have opted to use oversize Voile straps instead of the included accessory straps since Voile straps are less fiddly in cold temps with numb fingers or with gloves on.

3. I would like symmetrical, internal, side-mounted pockets for a water bottle and radio. Not essential, but when your pack is mostly empty, everything is either slumped in the bottom or zipped up in the top compartment. It all works, but it is a nice feature that would make this a bit more polished. 

Buy this pack. You will not regret it. In bounds, out of bounds, travel, everyday, it works.
review.name: Almost PERFECT

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bag a few weeks ago to use as a skiing/snowshoeing pack in the winter, and as an all-season pack for photography gear (the back panel opening works well for this purpose). I went with the 34L Pro size because the expandable rolltop seemed like a good option to have, especially with a camera cube taking up a lot of the space in the main compartment. The Pro size also has an extra pocket on the front for skins or other stuffable items, that the next size down doesn't have.

Materials:

Very durable construction, great straps and attachment points. The black color looks kind of gray in the product photos, but it's actually a very normal backpacky black.

Features:

The external features of the pack are excellent. I really like how many strap points there are. Even though there aren't water bottle holders on the side, you can use the two loops on the lower part of the side panel to mount an external water bottle carrier. You can also strap all sorts of stuff to the outside using the other mount points, such as skis, snowshoes, helmet, ice axe, tripod, etc.

If anyone else was thinking of using this for camera gear: The main compartment fits an F-Stop Medium Shallow camera cube but it's a bit of a squeeze (maybe 0.5" too large in depth and width). Dakine makes a slightly smaller cube for their ski packs that would fit really well, and of course there are tons of others on the market.

The avy gear and skins pockets are fairly slim so you can pretty much only use them for their intended purposes, especially if the main pocket is stuffed. The rolltop is useful when you need more space for a jacket or something. It's also cool how it packs away and makes the pack look pretty "normal" rather than like a hiking pack with the 4-strap cap top.

One thing I'd change is to provide more structure/support to the plastic loop that acts as the frame and the bottom of the pack, so that it stands up on its own more easily and keeps its shape when the back panel is zipped open for packing/removing items.

Sizing:

The 34L runs a little big - specifically it's a long top to bottom. I'm 5'9" and wear a 30" to 32" pant size and felt like I was really tightening down the straps to keep the pack stable and transfer the weight to my hips. Since I also want to use the bag in the summer, and the back padding isn't super breathable compared to dedicated 3-season packs, I ordered the 32L SL to see if it had a more natural fit. The Deuter site recommends the SL size (32L in this case) for men who wear a small or medium size, although they also call it a women's size and attaches a tag saying so to the pack. I attached some photos - the 34L is black and the 32L is blue. Differences:

- The 34L waist strap fins are 10.75" long, 32L fins are 9.75". The fins might be at a slight inward angle on the 32 compared to the vertical attachment on the 34. The hip strap felt a bit more comfortable for me in the 32.

- The 32L straps are thinner by about 0.25 to 0.5", shorter by about 2", and the top of the straps are attached to the pack 0.5" lower down. I didn't like the thin shape as much but I understand that's the key women-specific detail in the SL fit.

- Other dimensions seem almost the same, the 34L might be a tiny bit wider. Not sure where the 2L difference comes from.

Ultimately I'm keeping the 34L because I like the black color better and it's close enough in fit, but if you are any smaller than me I'd definitely consider the SL size.
review.name: Solid choice

name: Freerider Pro 34L+ Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Usually I like Assos but these are a huge fail. I purchased these on sale despite ridiculous price and unfortunately the right glove is tearing at seams after 2-3 rides, less than 100miles riding on tarmac. No falls, mechanicals, etc, literally only touched the bars and my water bottle. 

Certainly look cool, thin material breathes well but obviously too fragile for anything beyond being replaced after every stage of the Tour if you happen to be sponsored.
review.name: Zero Stars- Tearing After >100mi

hasVariant.name: Resolve 25L Endless Promise Backpack - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Resolve 25L Endless Promise Backpack - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This pack joined me on a recent trip to Mexico and was the absolute best travel and day pack for that purpose! It is big enough to hold all the essentials, perfectly adjustable and has an extremely comfortable women's specific fit!! My only wish would be a slightly larger water bladder sleeve and maybe and exterior mesh/stretch pocket on the front for added exterior storage.
review.name: Best Travel Companion

review.reviewBody: Pack has adjustability, great padding for maximum comfort, water resistant material to help shed rain. These new backpacks are a solid build and made to withstand the harsh elements of the outdoors. I wish there were more color options, my only wish! I am not a big fan of the colors, but the bag itself is very nice! If you are looking for a new day pack to get out on the trail with, this is the one!
review.name: Best Day Pack

review.reviewBody: Recently got mine as a staple day pack to take with me on short adventures. It is very well made, and the womens specific straps make it a comfortable fit. Personally I’d want one or two more internal pockets if I could add anything, but overall this pack exceeds my expectations!
review.name: Cute and functional

review.reviewBody: Haven’t gotten to hike with it yet, but it has everything I was hoping for in a bag. The extra straps that you can attach out on the front are clutch, I live in Colorado and layers are a part of life!  Will update once I’ve gone live with it.
review.name: Great day pack

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Women 25L Revolve daypack recently and have taken it on a few test outings to see how it holds up. I like a lot of the features including all of the adjustable options which allows for a better fit and really like the blue granite colour. I also like the water bottle compartment on the sides. It feels secure when I put a water bottle in it. I tested it out on a rainy day and it held up pretty well. There was some water on it but it repelled off and dried up super fast. Some of the features I think that could use improvements include the cardboard in the front that once it gets bent I felt like I was breaking it. It could also use more pockets. It only has the main storage area and a smaller pocket inside it as well as a smaller pocket outside that can be hard to access at times. The hip strap is a bit weak too and I was hoping for more support. Overall seems good so far, but could definitely use some improvements.
review.name: Good backpack so far

review.reviewBody:
Pack seems super nice so far. I haven't packed it FULL, but overall, so much versatility and functionality. The straps in the pack, adjustable water bottle holders, etc. Only "complaint" is that I wish the main compartment was a little easier to open quickly and the bag felt a lil less top heavy.

Really comfortable shoulder and hip straps too.
review.name: Well thought out pack

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my wife and she absolutely loves it. Have taken it on a few hikes as well as a carry on for a flight. This is a great light multifunction day pack that she has been very much enjoying!
review.name: Great multifunction day bag

review.reviewBody: I love how this pack feels on my back. I had my last pack for 10 years and I thought I’d totally go back to the same brand so glad I didn’t. Great job.
review.name: Great overall design

review.reviewBody: Nemo hits it out of the park once again with their Women Specific 25L Resolve Pack! I Love how adjustable it is and how well it fits my petite 5’2” short torso frame. Lightweight, Holds everything I need for a long day hike and is super comfortable!
review.name: Loving this women’s specific pack!

review.reviewBody: We got this just in time for a trip across the west from the Grand Canyon, to Yosemite, to Zion and it has been a perfect day hike backpack! This held jackets and snacks for me and 3 boys. I have been very happy with how comfortable it is, I barely notice it’s there! It doesn’t hurt that it looks great too!
review.name: Perfect fit!

name: Resolve 25L Endless Promise Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Excellent Poles. Very light, the clasp is solid and they have a great feel. Left my last pair in Hokkaido somehow and didn't need to bother comparing poles again since I like these so much.

Super pole.  Very light.  Very nice locking mechanism and detentes in the carbon to give it a solid click as you adjust lengths.  Easy to read length indicator.  Can be extended very long for pushing across flats or down shallow-sloped skin on the way home.  Strap is easy to adjust and stays put once adjusted.  Hook on the grip is handy for manipulating bindings and heel risers.  Can't think of anything that would make them better.

name: Powder Basket

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Escapist Frame Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I want to support Osprey's venturing into bikepacking but this bag falls short. First off, the center divider makes it so only skinny long items like a pump or jerky sticks will fit. This in combination with material that has zero stretch makes this bag unforgiving and not adaptable for bikepacking. Only used this bag for 1 trip because I need to maximize every inch and this bag weighed more and carried less. In comparison, I bought an Oveja Negra top tube bag that had some stretch along with compartments that allow for a wider range of shapes to fit.
review.name: No room for bulky items

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the storage, easy pull zippers that tuck away so they don't dangle, and slim inner pockets to keep the debit card snugly tucked away. I was surprised at the sturdy structure of this bag. So far so good with it. Only complaint is that the velcro straps snag my bike shorts/bibs when I stand or when I'm off the saddle pedaling. Thinking about a way to put another piece of fabric over it...
review.name: Love the storage, easy pull

name: Escapist Frame Bag

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love Vardag Anorak for its good quality and durability. The material is thick and it is versatile for different occasions and weathers. I got a desert brown one and it looks great on me. This one runs a large than usual size. But if you are going to layer some clothes underneath then it is true to size! I'm 58kg/161cm and I could fit into size XXS, XS, and S. I have narrow shoulders, but size XXS makes me feel a bit tight on my shoulder when I move around my arms. XS is a good fit to me but not enough for extra layers. Eventually I got a size S. (I normally wear S-M).
review.name: Love it so much!

review.reviewBody: Super cute jacket and really comfortable, easy to wax and waterproof. It just runs really big - I normally wear a medium and I could have easily worn a small or even an extra small.
review.name: Runs big

review.reviewBody: Despite the fact that I love fjallraven products, this one is a huge disappointment for me. It does not hold any water - you get wet immediately. It says you need to wax it - I've tired - several times - does not help at all. Absolutely not worth buying it - money thrown away.
review.name: Terrible - you get wet even in a light rain

review.reviewBody: This just arrived and it’s awesome! I am generally an XL-XXL and large busted but read the reviews that the coat fit large so took a chance. Generally speaking Fjallraven isn’t very size inclusive but big girls like enjoy the outdoors too! The quality, placement of pockets, side zip, and hood are all very well done.
review.name: Great for larger busted women!!

review.reviewBody: This is a great anorak. I’m 5’2 120lbs athletic build and wear an XS in everything Fjällräven except I wear a S in t-shirts and leggings. Based on the reviews of this running big I ordered an XXS and I’m glad I did. It fits perfect. I can wear a thin layer underneath and still have room. I have some anoraks from other brands that also run big, so I think that’s just the style of these garments. It’s comfortable and the fabric isn’t too thick.
review.name: Great Anorak. Runs Big.

review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket so much!
I'm 5 ft. 4, 130 lbs, and Medium fits well for me. It is a bit on the roomy/baggy side, which I like since I could layer up with a thick sweater in colder months. I love the big front pocket feature for carrying keys, phone, and lip balms without worrying about it falling out.

It doesn't show in the detailed photos but there's a little mesh pocket within the side pocket to tuck in your keys safely(I love this feature!). I got it in deep forest color (which is no longer available I think), and I get compliments all the time when I'm wearing it. I will cherish this jacket for many seasons to come.
review.name: My favorite Go-To Jacket

name: Vardag Anorak Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Secure buckle, belt is wide enough to fit tightly enough to not move, but still be comfortable  to not notice you’re wearing it.  Side pockets good for gels, snacks, etc.  Main rear pocket large enough for inner tubes & toolkit, but not for a windbreaker.  Small rear pocket good for wallet, keys, etc.
review.name: Fits well, useful amount of space

review.reviewBody:
This waist pack is super comfortable. Have only used it several times but it rides on my waist/hips great. No sagging even with a pretty full load. 

Hold two water bottles very tightly so no bobbing or popping out. 

Had a lightweight insulated jacket on one day and had to remove it and was able to strap it to the outside of the pack where it stayed put. 

Pleasantly surprised at how well the waist pack works and how comfortable it is to wear.
review.name: Dirt Roamer

name: Dirt Roamer Waist Pack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Supacaz Smash DH Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great deal. Work perfectly cheap and light. Very grippy
review.name: Good deal

review.reviewBody: The price was definatly right here
review.name: Great price prduct!!

review.reviewBody:
I'm a fairly experienced mountain biker, obsessed with the sport.  I've been through many pedals to find the ones that fit me best.  Honestly, a lot are great.  Additionally, many are very similar.

The Supacaz Smash pedals are very good.  At the time of writing, with the sale price, definitely 5 stars.  At the retail price.. no way!  Composite pedals should really top out at $40 or so.  Hence the 4 star rating I assigned.

The pedals ARE concave.  Don't let the axle bearing/bushing bulges fool you.  The outer pins sit at a higher vertical vs the central pins.  This concave pin arrangement is great for grip.

In all I can't find any functional faults wit this pedal.  The platform is a good size, the profile is a decently thin.  I would take this over the Raceface Chester's any day (worse grip).  These Supacaz pedals are also sold as the TAG Metals T3.  Another similar pedal is the Bontrager/Trek Line Elite which I also recommend.  Overall, a nice pedal, all one really needs.  The composite material used for this pedal has a nice rigid/hefty feel so does feel more solid (eg. closer to aluminum pedals) than the Bontrager underfoot.
review.name: Surprised these pedals have no reviews.

name: Smash DH Pedals

review.reviewBody: The laces help get a custom fit.  These shoes are great for beginners because the toes aren't curled in.  They are comfortable to wear without having to take them off frequently.
review.name: Try them on, buy in two sizes

review.reviewBody: THE SIZING ON THESE ARE WAY OFF.  AT LEAST 2 SIZES JUST LIKE THE OTHER REVIEW I WISH TO GOD I WOULD HAVE READ.
review.name: ARE THESE CHILDRENS SHOES?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality but the sizing is totally off and needs to be reviewed.
review.name: Order 2+ sizes bigger

review.reviewBody: Okay. So I may have your attention. This is a belated review of the Five Ten Razors. Those crazy green shoes with the lavender laces. I used to climb at the New every weekend and these shoes performed great on steep face climbs. Loved 'em!
review.name: Shear DEElight

review.reviewBody: Got these as Christmas gift... they use the size chart and ordered based on my normal shoe size. Those were extremely small(I couldn't even put them on!) I sent them back and ordered  1.5 size larger  It's still very small.  And yes, I do know that rock climbing shoes are not supposed to be comfortable, But, these are beyond uncomfortable...
review.name: The size chart isn't accurate at all

review.reviewBody: This isn’t a “runs small” situation. It’s a “the sizing is so off, unless you can try them on in person, you should not buy them” situation. I know climbing shoes fit tight. I like my climbing shoes even tighter than that. Still, I ordered my usual RUNNING SHOE size; those of you who run know that means .5 UP. Erred on the very large side given the online order. They were so small I could barely put them on, and once they were on, I was basically making a fist with my toes and couldn’t lace them or stand up. Didn’t even know my foot could bend like that. Really bummer because this is a beautiful, well-made, versatile shoe, but it unfortunately has to go straight back in the mail. Please do not discontinue — just fix sizing!
review.name: Awful experience — sizing

review.reviewBody: I love the shoes and the quality seems to be pretty good the size... I go with Adidas size 8 (8.5 sometimes). Friends wanted to get these as a gift for me and bout me size 9. It is still so small. I know your toes should be bent a bit in climbing shoes but these 1 seize bigger than my normal shoe and still are at the point of breaking my toes!
review.name: Runs too small

name: Niad Lace Climbing Shoe - Women's
